title: Gurage people
summary: The Gurage people (/ɡʊəˈrɑːɡeɪ/)[5] (Gurage: ጉራጌ) are a Semitic-speaking ethnic group inhabiting Ethiopia.[2] They inhabit the  Gurage Zone, a fertile, semi-mountainous region in central Ethiopia, about 125 kilometers southwest of Addis Ababa, bordering the Awash River in the north, the Gibe River, a tributary of the Omo River, to the southwest, and Hora-Dambal in the east.
